question: Question_07_(a)
statement:
Let $T: \mathbb{R}^2 \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ be the linear
transformation that reflects points through the line \emph{3x = 4y}.

\textbf{a)} Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the standard matrix
\emph{A} of \emph{T}. (Note: In order to do this, you do not need to
evaluate \emph{A}.)
hints:
Draw a picture which illustrates what the reflection does to a few
example vectors.

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  What does the reflection do to a vector that is on the line $4y = 3x$?
\item
  What does the reflection do to a vector that is orthogonal to the line
  $4y=3x$?
\end{itemize}
